title: Fiery exchanges at refugee debate in St Helier
text:
Politicians, panelists and members of the public were angrily heckled at a meeting at a public meeting about refugees this afternoon.
A group of islanders jeered when it was suggested Jersey should play its part in supporting Syrian refugees by housing five families in the island.
Plenty of others however, supported the concept of housing Syrian refugee families in Jersey.
One woman told ITV News she would happily welcome some into her own home.
At one point in the meeting, a woman whose face was covered with a black head scarf was heckled with shouts of "show your face" with another person even saying "yes, I am a racist".
We are currently in conversation with the UK government about whether we can help by taking some Syrian refugees. But, if the community isn't going to accept them it wouldn't be right to bring them here.
